results.title: Shearing technique
results.brief_description: A demonstration showing correct methods of shearing sheep. A shearer demonstrates the most common faults found in shearing and slow-motion “shots” help to emphasise the important points of good shearing.

results.title: She shall be called woman
results.brief_description: Depicts the position of women in primitive African societies. As Biblical texts concerning the creation of women, her place in society, and her influence on the affairs of mankind through the ages are read, the ideas are visualised through selected primitive African sculpture.
results.description: Depicts the position of women in primitive African societies. As Biblical texts concerning the creation of women, her place in society, and her influence on the affairs of mankind through the ages are read, the ideas are visualised through selected primitive African sculpture.

results.title: Shaw versus Shakespeare. Part 1: the character of Caesar
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and John Barnes
results.brief_description: George Bernard Shaw, played by Donald Moffatt, analyses Shakespear’s characterisation of Julis Caesar and compares it with his won treatment. Shaw claims the character of Caesar was beyind Shakespeare, but admits Shakespear is still the “King of the dramatists”.

results.title: Sharpening and tempering farm tools
results.brief_description: Explains how to treat carbon-steel tools for forge sharpening; how to sharpen, harden and temper a cultivator and a ploughshare shovel; how to identify tempering colours. From the series “Farm work forging”.

results.title: Sharpening and grinding
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”.
This film shows an array of tools which it is essential to keep sharp. These include the chisel, paring chisel, mortise chisel, the gouge and other curved tools, the cutting edges of all of which need to be kept sharp on an oilstone. The correct way of doing this is shown in detail and the latter half of the film describes the regrinding of tools, ending with a reminder that rust is thae principal enemy of steel tools. This can be kept down by frequent sharpening and the use of vaseline on the tools when put away for any length of time.

results.title: Sharkey's Party
results.brief_description: Sharky’s friends throw a wild party to celebrate his homecoming after six months of psychiatric treatment. This is a satirical look at friendship in the 1980s and the “sex and drugs and rock n roll” ethos.

results.title: Shark
results.creator_credit: Roone Arledge, Learning Corporation of America and Scott Ransom
results.brief_description: Presents some of the characteristics and habits of sharks in particular the white pointer, the tiger shark, and the bronze whaler. Peter Benchley, author of “Jaws”, guides us through the ancient times to sharks to modern day. They dive near Gladstone, in Queensland, a small fishing port on the East Coast of Australia, diving in the Barrier Reef; diving also takes place in South Australia, near Seal Island.
